description:
openpgp: support 3DES encrypted private keys.

It appears that CentOS (and so I presume Fedora/RHEL too) default to
encrypting private keys with 3DES so it looks like we need to support
that.

Fixes issue 3940.

messages.text:
*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=69c3cdaaffb7&repo=crypto ***

openpgp: support 3DES encrypted private keys.

It appears that CentOS (and so I presume Fedora/RHEL too) default to
encrypting private keys with 3DES so it looks like we need to support
that.

Fixes issue 3940.

R=golang-dev, r
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/6446121

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go.crypto

subject: code review 6446121: openpgp: support 3DES encrypted private keys.
